DataElement.preferredName: Invasive Breast Carcinoma Per 10 High Powered Fields Mitotic Count Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The amount of mitoses per 10 high power fields in breast tissue represented using the Nottingham scoring system.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Microscopic Findings Domain Invasive Breast Carcinoma Per 10 High Powered Fields Mitotic Count
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microscopic findings._A carcinoma that infiltrates the breast parenchyma.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas arising from the terminal ductal lobular unit (TDLU).  Often, the invasive adenocarcinoma co-exists with ductal or lobular carcinoma in situ.  It is the most common carcinoma affecting women._A unit of measurement of the number of entities per unit of area equal to ten high powered fields._The number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors.  It is one of the parameters that determine the grade of malignant tumors.  The method of counting varies, according to the specific tumor examined.  Usually the mitotic count is determined based on the number of mitoses per high power field (40X) or 10 high power fields.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microscopic findings.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microscopic findings.

Property.preferredName: Invasive Breast Carcinoma Per 10 High Powered Fields Mitotic Count
Property.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma that infiltrates the breast parenchyma.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas arising from the terminal ductal lobular unit (TDLU).  Often, the invasive adenocarcinoma co-exists with ductal or lobular carcinoma in situ.  It is the most common carcinoma affecting women.:A unit of measurement of the number of entities per unit of area equal to ten high powered fields.:The number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors.  It is one of the parameters that determine the grade of malignant tumors.  The method of counting varies, according to the specific tumor examined.  Usually the mitotic count is determined based on the number of mitoses per high power field (40X) or 10 high power fields.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma that infiltrates the breast parenchyma.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas arising from the terminal ductal lobular unit (TDLU).  Often, the invasive adenocarcinoma co-exists with ductal or lobular carcinoma in situ.  It is the most common carcinoma affecting women.
A unit of measurement of the number of entities per unit of area equal to ten high powered fields.

The number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors.  It is one of the parameters that determine the grade of malignant tumors.  The method of counting varies, according to the specific tumor examined.  Usually the mitotic count is determined based on the number of mitoses per high power field (40X) or 10 high power fields.
